ratings.comment: Professor Sintim is a compassionate educator. Personal struggles led to considering dropping his class. He offered a Zoom meeting and provided support to help continue the course. His assistance proved invaluable. I took and incomplete but he was very empathetic.

Daniel's commitment to student learning is evident in his high level of responsiveness and thorough feedback. Critiques are not only detailed but also clearly explained, making them an excellent tool for understanding and improvement. His midterm and final papers allow students to choose a policy design  or memo on topics of  their interest.

Professor Sintim was clear, engaging, and supportive. His passion for teaching and care for students' well-being stood out. The course was well-structured and informative, making complex content easy to understand, though it offered limited opportunities for student-to-student interaction as it was asynchronous class.

Daniel is an engaging and effective educator who presents child welfare policies and programs with clarity. His interactive teaching style encourages critical thinking and meaningful discussions. He provides well-organized materials, connect theory to real-world applications, and offer valuable feedback, ensuring a rewarding learning experience.
